Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Stela in the name of Kham-Hor
Description: This limestone stela, which was acquired in the art trade in 1974, is decorated with a scene in which the owner, named Kham-Hor, presents an offering to the ibis-headed god Thoth. Between the two people, a large ibis is perched on a standard. Behind the god there is a falcon with two feathers, standing on a papyrus stem. Kham-Hor exercised the function of "Priest of ibis",  linked with the cult of sacred animals. The text beneath of the scene contains an offering formula.
